Advice for Future Co-op Students

Tips for a Successful Co-op Experience

  • Be proactive and take initiative when working on projects. Don't wait for instructions—identify areas where you can contribute.
  • Maintain clear and consistent communication with your supervisor and team members. Use tools like Slack or email effectively.
  • Document your work thoroughly. Write clear commit messages, keep project notes, and ensure your code is well-commented.
  • Don’t be afraid to ask questions. Learning from your supervisor and peers is a crucial part of the co-op experience.
  • Set personal goals for the placement. Identify the skills you want to develop and focus on achieving them.

Key Lessons Learned

Throughout my co-op placement, I learned the importance of time management, self-motivation, and staying adaptable in a remote work environment. The ability to balance work responsibilities with school commitments taught me valuable skills that I will carry forward in my career.

Brandon Zhong.

Built with HTML, Tailwind CSS, and a lot of learning!
